Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: LMdNiC
Reviews.Content: Organised a little catch up with European mates, a bit last minute and found 4 beds in a 6-bed dorm for Â£35/pppn. Welcoming staff, clean throughout. Toilet and showers are shared but clean. It wasn't too noisy. Breakfast was ok,nothing crazy: toast, cheese,salami, boiled egg, jams etc... coffee and tea. Check out the red light window on the side window ... in essence it's not for families with kids. They have Wifi and free password protected lockers in the room so it's reasonably safe. So long as you don't mind living it the hostel way, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritali294217
Reviews.Content: The price is not cheap at all. The main reason for choosing this hotel is its location, only 10 min walk from train station and the hotel has an elevator because we carry heavy luggages. It is really not easy to find a hotel in Amsterdam with this price and have an elevator. Surrounding area of the hotel is safe though near red light district. Breakfast is ok but not good. Our room is a quadroom with two bunk beds, very small, dark and bed is not comfortable. Room is quiet. Toilet is outside our room but exclusively for your use.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a nice cool place and staff!”
Reviews.Author: sergio s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tourist Inn for 5 days at the end of August, and I must say that yes, it was crowded, but the place was a really cool cozy place to be. I paid â‚¬30 a night, slept with 5 other strangers but nice people, and I found the place to be all around a clean, safe, and comfortable place to be. The breakfast food was abundant, the staff was always helpful, the towels and sheets were spark clean readily available if I needed a new one, the bathrooms and showers were clean, and when a guest needs to check out and ask to store the luggage there for a few hours, no problem whatsoever, and at no extra charge. I strongly recommend it!!! ah, and the wi-fi connection always worked!

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location but hugely over charged”
Reviews.Author: skinnyEngland
Reviews.Content: went off spec on a saturday dinnertime, 3 of us, after looking around for an hour this was it, 80 euro a man 2 single beds for 3 fellas..... defo recommend booking digs in advance ......good location just pricey..

Reviews.Title: “It was brilliant and staff very helpful and friendly, close to everything, never a dull moment”
Reviews.Author: pinkmarch52
Reviews.Content: Rooms smallish but very clean and tidy, great shower and breakfast, staff brilliant, loved the location close to Central Station, the canal and lots of great food. We loved it and the red light district was just beside this but the girls were all friendly and pleasant and livens the place up at night. Loved it can't wait to go back, brilliant and the new receotion looks great, the dining room is good but maybe they could do with blinds on the back window as it just looks straight into one of the girls windows, it could be off putting if you are narrow minded, xxx Loved the boy at reception he was so friendly, xx

Reviews.Title: “your all talking crap.”
Reviews.Author: danielbrooks2006
Reviews.Content: stayed here a year ago, and couldnt fault it. very friendly staff, we arrived before we could actually check in, we were offered free breakfast and they stored our luggage until we could get into our room. very basis rooms but i found it to be the most comfortable nights sleep id had in a long time, great advice given by the staff on which shops to visit and which areas to avoid. will definately return to this hotel. stop your moan people, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL BRIAN CLOSED”
Reviews.Author: OnCrutches
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of 18 friends booked the hotel brian to find when we got there the 'hotel' had been brought out and our booking had been lost. With this in mind the owner then decided he could only put us up for 1 night charging us Â£50 Euros each instead of the Â£35 Euros we agreed when booking. The owner is only after a quick buck, once your money is handed over he doesnt care less... I strongly advise not staying there, only interested in getting your money, complete dive..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Skanky HOLE”
Reviews.Author: TheLodgernumber1
Reviews.Content: this place is a dirty smelly hole they have a cheek calling it a HOTEL. our money got stolen the place is just generally horrible. it is a poor mans Hostel go somewhere else or you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO. DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: o0Najwa0o
Reviews.Content: Cheap and in city center. ok! the receptionist was very kind till we said we didnÂ´t want to stay there. the stair are to small to carry a big luggage, u need 2 people. the room was ok but there was a [--] in the shower O_O. I couldn't even look at it coz the smell was too horrible!. then the receptionist started to be unfriendly and tried to get the money for the all days(U only have to pay the 1st one), she started to scream and made us pay for the key (we left in the room the luggage while finding another place)...she was suppoused to give that money back...but she only gave the 75% O_O... it's ok if U go to have party and don't mind the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap 'n' cheerful B&B - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kane1972
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in Hotel Brian for a while, but was pleasantly surprised. I booked it because it was cheaper than any of the other 1* or 2* budget hotels with private rooms in Amsterdamage. It has new owners, who have made-over the place considerably with new carpets and beds. The room was pretty basic, with a bed and sink, and shared showers and toilets on each floor. Breakfast was included, only I never woke up in time. No lock-in, unlike some of the crappy hostels in 'Dam. The main plus point for me was that the sheets / duvet and towels were clean, and there were NO bed-bugs or mice (unlike the Utopia or Hotel Jimmy, where I stayed the last couple of times I was Amsterdamned). Good points: Cheap rates, friendly staff, good central location (on Singel canal), clean / tidy. Room could do with a TV though! Will definitely come here again next time I crash and burn in Amsterdamnation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bobtyankovic
Reviews.Content: Listen to what everyone else is saying. This place has bed bugs - I've just got home from staying there and I'm covered in bites. I don't think anything else needs to be said about the hotel apart from that.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: kanhete
Reviews.Content: I always book the cheapest option in each city I travel, so Im used to small rooms, noisy young people, poor breakfasts and shared bathrooms,thats why they are cheap. Even so, I get impressed with the dirtiness of this place. They didnt clean the room and bathroom in all 4 days we stayed. There are bed bugs, possibly because I guess they dont change sheets between guests. But the worst thing is, we found a mouse in our room running over our bed. If you are asking why the black cat at the hall is so fat, well thats the reason. We complaint at the owner, who was drunk and smelly and simply told us "is just a mouse". So book here only if you like to sleep with mice.

Reviews.Title: “the worst place ive ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: fletchy55
Reviews.Content: shocking accomodation, dirty, smelly, basic, there were stains on sheets, bedbugs,rubbish in room when we arrived, i definately would never stay there again! when we arrived, we unpacked our clothes and went out, we took all our valuables with us....thank god, as wen we came back an hour later, someone had been in our room and taken our perfume, the staff were rude, especially the cleaner who i suspect was the perfume thief...i cant comment on the breakfast, as i wouldnt dare consume anything prepared on those disgusting premises!! amsterdam was a lovely place, just a shame it was spoilt by the accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Ok, could have been better”
Reviews.Author: chloemia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. When I arrived the receptionist was friendly and welcoming. Stairs are very narrow and hard to walk up especially with luggage. Entered the room and the door hit the bed it was so small. Room was very basic had a double bed and a sink thats about it. Walls are very thin and can hear the rooms next door. Was bitten by a bug dont know what one lol but left some nice itchy marks for me and my boyfriend. Was not too keen on the shared toilet was smelly and hardly cleaned shower was ok. Did not wake up for breakfast attempted to on the last day and all the tables were full so no breakfast. Overall I believe the hotel is ok good value for money what do you expect really. I recommend it for friends though not couples.

Reviews.Title: “A bad hotel, representing no value for money.”
Reviews.Author: twosheds1
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at Hotel Brian, having read most of the reviews on this site. We found the place to be utterly smoker-unfriendly. The stairs were too steep, the rooms too small, the walls too thin, the toilet too smelly, the shower too drity, the view disgusting (on a cigarette-butt riddled courtyard)... given all these inconveniences, anything more than â‚¬10 a night is a rip-off. After our first night there, we promptly checked out and moved to a hotel on Damrak, "De Korenaer". The three-star hotel provided an en-suite WC and shower, as well as a TV and a view on Damrak, for a better price than Hotel Brian.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, value for money, rather safe”
Reviews.Author: AerialUk
Reviews.Content: We were 2girls travelling together. Given that this is Amsterdam, this hostel was quite safe. Despite having a red light shop a few doors down, it wasn't as "active" at night as the other streets. Truly no frills. Bunk beds. Friendly staff. Toilet smelled a bit musty because it didn't have ventilation. Overall, really good value for money. But if I had to go Amsterdam again, I would book in advance so that I can get some place else for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brian RULES!”
Reviews.Author: emnmatt1923
Reviews.Content: Hey everyone at hotel brian its the swifts here! loved staying at hotel brian wicked breakfasts! excellent staff really enjoyed our stay there. we were made to feel very welcome, brent gave us a lot of advice and told us where to find the best coffee shops and cheap places to eat, we were also able to use the vapouriser whenever we wanted which was wicked! this hotel is ideal for a cheap weekend or week. would definitely come again fantastic location two streets or so away from the main strip (damrak) Fantastic staff cheers for a wicked holiday guys hope to see you guys very soon Emily & Matt Swift

Reviews.Title: “two twelve hour shiftsh”
Reviews.Author: BigErn13
Reviews.Content: well, where do i shtart... shcrambled or fried.... that is the breakfast choice. i've climbed easier mountains, i now have calfs like house bricks because of the incline on the stairs. don't get locked out of your room because nobody will come to your help because of two twelve hour shiftsh, you'll have to hope there is another room open for you to find shelter on a floor... this is all true. don't leave razor blades out as when we were there there was a phanton eye brow trimmer. We were on a stag do and i strongly believe that hostel is kitted out for this sort of trip and this only. on a good note the location is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “horrendous”
Reviews.Author: hapagirl_italy
Reviews.Content: I think it's safe to say that this accommodation ruined my whole experience of Amsterdam. Luckily I was there only for 2 nights, as I don't think I would have survived a third. To be fair, we did not stay in the normal part of "Hotel Brian" but a sort of annex, a few doors down. In this part of the hotel there is no reception and no one there to help if you happen to need it. Nevermind the stairs, as there's not much you can do about the extraordinarily steep tiny stairs in Amsterdam, but the rooms were shockingly basic. I know it's a hostel. But that doesn't mean that it has to be foul. We paid a whopping 100 euro for a 4 bed room (4 friends traveling) and it was disgusting. The light in the ONLY bathroom in the building (that served I think at least 4 other rooms) was out. Which meant having to go to the toilet with the door open! I also think the other guests in the hostel were part of the terrible stay - all young, drunk males, who not only kept us up all night with their loud singing and hollering, but apparently also could not tell the difference between the toilet bowl and the floor. So you can imagine what the bathroom with no light looked like the next morning. I might add that this bathroom was also the only one with a shower. I did not shower, or go to the toilet in the hostel the entire weekend I was there. Surprisingly, this was not cleaned up (nor was the light fixed) while we were there. We also had been told breakfast was served until 10:30am, so seeing as we had gotten no sleep thanks to the other guests, we decided to sleep in and go for breakfast at 10am. But at 10am breakfast was closed and we couldn't get any since the girl wanted to go home. This was just the first night staying here. I can't say the second one was any better. Stay away from this place. It's not worth it whatsoever. Amsterdam can be a charming city full of culture and has many other beautiful places that are not expensive (we had already tried but they were booked) so don't let that be ruined by staying in such a shoddy place - so just look around, book ahead and save yourselves before having to settle on this place!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here if you paid me!”
Reviews.Author: ClareandMichaelPerth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had booked 4 nights stay at Hotel Brian for July 2008. When we arrived we were able to check straight into our room. They only took cash so we arranged to put our bags in our room and go get more cash out. Trying to get up the stairs to the top floor was like climbing a ladder. The stairs were so steep & small it was nearly impossible with backpacks. If you had a suitcase you wouldn't be able to get up the stairs. Once on the top floor (3rd or 4th floor) we entered our Double Room with Shared Bathroom facilties. We were due to pay $87AUD per night for this room. The lock on the door was faulty. The room was unbelievably small, smelly and not particularly clean. The 'Double Bed' was more like a single cot on the floor. And the room had no furniture. I have no doubt in my mind there would have been bed bugs. The roof was just a skylight that was covered in dirt and the window was small & dirty with bars across. To make matters worse, the toilet was filthy and the shower/bathroom was OUT OF ORDER! That was the last straw for us so we went downstairs, paid for the first night to be fair and left to find other accommodation. I definitely would not recommend this place unless you are extremely tight on money and don't mind sleeping in filth. This is more like a really bad hostel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: Alabama_W
Reviews.Content: Well well well, after reading the reviews on this website, me and my two friends thought we were in for four nights in hell, but we were so relieved when we got there! The staff we met were nice enough, the hostel is central to everything (we were put in brian's sister hostel, hotel liberty), and the room (we booked a three person room), though a little dingy and small, is what we payed for. Our room was quite clean, the beds surprisingly cosy, and the toilet/bathing facilities cleaned regularly. I do agree, our window view was a lot to be desired (a wall), plus if we hadn't had our details printed off the booking website they would have put us down for 3 nights due to a mix up, but we really didnt have a bad stay. The steep stairs to our floor just added to the dutch charm. We payed for four nights what it would have cost for maybe one night in london. There was a breakfast, but we always just missed it, however I'm sure i would have been satisfied with toast and eggs. It is basic accomodation, but the location and the lack of curfew make it worth more than they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place Great People”
Reviews.Author: skunkweedman
Reviews.Content: Second time.We was Welcomed with a warm smile and a handshake. The land-lady and manager remembered us straight away.The Hotel is Located in the quite part of Amsterdam and cheap in price.and easy to find. I could have sat outside all day and watched the world go by (its not 5 stars) and you pay for what you get.Hotel Brians friendly staff and warm atomsphere is worth 10 stars love and resect to all the staff see you all in march 2009

Reviews.Title: “50/50 response some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: kevbaby
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place to stay if you really are on a budget. I found that staff were not too helpful with the whole explaining breakfast so had to enquire what we were to do. We were told to be down for breakfast @ 8am and went down and waited for half an hour to be served raw eggs. The scrambled egg is fine along with the toast, fresh bread. Thats the complete breakfast menu! Has a coffee machine for tea and coffee which was nice and you could help yourself all day to that which was a good thing. The rooms were small but were clean and the bed linen was clean. Overall for the money it was good I would only say that the staff could have been slightly more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “worst experince in hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: moontheloon
Reviews.Content: I was currently working in Amsterdam and staying at a hostel till my house was finally sorted out.The hostel was booked that weekend so i thought I would stay at hotel Brian.I booked my weekend on the tuesday before,with an eastern european girl at the desk.I didnt get a receipt or piece of paper.ok I thought and thought no more of it.When i got there on the saturday morning with my luggage, I was welcomed by a sleazy american guy in a tracksuit and baseball cap.Low and behold they had no booking or record of me-this guy and a rather strict unpleasent dutch manageress, I think she was, asked who i had booked with-i said an eastern european girl on tuesday ,and they both looked at each other expectantly, the manageress saying" why does she do this to me?"as if she makes a habit of it.I have to say I went crackers. I was severly p****d off and the manageress turned very nasty.This sleazy american got really sarcastic and couldnt really bothered to help.Boy was he creepy.Something played by Peter Stormore.One other guy there, South African ,who used to work there arranged for me to be taken round the corner to a place called Hotel Tamara.It was owned by same management. As i was leaving I shouted to the manageress "thanks for a lovely stay" and she told me to [--] off.But this was in front of the other customers at the hotel.PR not her strong point..The hotel Tamara I had to pay for at least 2 days and it cost me an extra 30 euros more than what i was expecting to pay at hotel Brian and the place was horrendous....It cost 100 euros ..The room was like a cupboard---I mean a cupboard.The guy behind the desk was an old guy from Australia,whom I noticed had to have his trousers down at the back ,permanantly having his backside hanging out at the back.....lets just say i kept my door well and truly locked at night.I felt really sorry for a few people there on holiday...eg mothers and their children.they probably thought they were getting a good deal.sorry folks,with cheap in Amsterdam ,you are not even getting false economy-you are getting total [--].And I lived in Amsterdam for 8 months and got sick of people getting ripped off by this city..hotel Brian is a good example of this.AVOID at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not *that* bad”
Reviews.Author: sea-lon-sf
Reviews.Content: There have been some really bad reviews for this hotel here but I think it's not *that* bad. I stayed at this same hotel almost 20 years ago and went back again recently - a lot can change in 20 years. I'll start off with a plus: It's very conveniently located within walking distance to Centraal Station. And now for the rest: We were scolded a bit by the woman at reception for being late - it certainly wasn't our fault that our flight was four hours late departing from the U.S. and I certainly wasn't going to call them from the U.S. to tell them we would be arriving late. She then proceeded to try to charge us 10 euro more per night than what we'd been quoted via email. Luckily, I had a copy of the email with me and once she saw that I had been quoted the price and had back and forth emails with her boss, her attitude changed quickly for the better. However, I think we were given the worst double room possible for arriving late - it was about the size of a closet directly across from the toilet. The "double" bed is not much bigger than a twin, but overall, it was clean enough. The bath and shower were also clean enough and there were no fleas/bedbugs. The Hotel Brian is not the kind of place you stay in if you expect to sleep (rather thin walls with people having lots of fun in their rooms), but most of the people working there are friendly, laid back and it's a bit of a family atmosphere at breakfast. They did not ask us to do our own dishes like another reviewer wrote. We could have had eggs, but chose to have toast with peanut butter and coffee that you can serve yourself. If you're expectations are low, and you want a cheap, central place to stay in Amsterdam, this hotel might suit your needs just fine. For me, I think I've outgrown it and will find another hotel the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great city - awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GilbertSwansea
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from my sonâ€™s stag weekend where we were booked into the Hotel Brian as a group of 21. We had already read the comments on this site and were pretty disappointed and apprehensive about what we were going to find. Well to my amazement it was worse than expected, 3 of the guys just about turned and booked elsewhere immediately. On our arrival we were told that the price of the rooms had gone up due to the drop in the Â£ and that we all needed to pay an extra 47 Euros (we stayed for 3 nights) each. We then had to pay 20 Euros for each key that was to be refunded when we handed them in at the end of our stay, which we had to fight to get back! We were then allocated rooms, some 4, some 5 and a couple of 2 men rooms. They were all basic with old metal framed beds with badly stained and dirty mattresses and ripped and torn sheets. The 5th bed in the 5 man rooms was a mattress on the floor and some of the 2 man rooms had a 'double bed'! Just what you need on a stag night! The place was very run down, showers on some floors didn't work, and breakfast was awful - highly not recommended even if itâ€™s just somewhere to crash after a night on the pop!

Reviews.Title: “Gross don't do it is my advice”
Reviews.Author: happycamper066
Reviews.Content: If you are a stoner and you are having a wild weekend and just want somewhere to crash then this is the place for you. it has internet and TV downstairs, coffee most of the day and cheap booze in the vending machine and the staff are friendly enough but if you want to spend any time in your room forget it. We got there and our room was disgusting. Walls had gross stains up them (I don't even want to think about it). It had a nasty smell and the sheets on every bed had stains on them. Again don't ask, there was sick, one sheet looked like a bike had been ridden up the middle of it and one had suspicious white stains lovely. After much complaining they did change them for us but what they changed them with wasn't much better. if you showered early then the showers were clean but they got dirty very quickly and it was easy to get stuck in them. Breakfast was ok but started about an hour later than advertised so if you want an early start you have to skip it. location by the canal not too bad but has red light ladies either side and doesn't make you feel particularly safe. Oh and stinks of weed of course. Steps are also incredibly steep so getting upstairs with a case is a no no. Not somewhere to stay if you don't want the run of the mill Amsterdam holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fleapit - Beware”
Reviews.Author: FrayBentosScotland
Reviews.Content: Horrible place. Ended up with lots of cute fleabites to show for our troubles. Got a room, or should i say cell, that had one very small horizontal window at ceiling height. This window looked out at ground level of someones roof garden, how very nice. The room was roasting hot, no air con and opening the window just let in mozzies. Never bothered with breakfast. The shared toilets were incredibly basic. If you want to have a reasonable holiday, avoid this hotel. If you dont care and are simply worried about price and are flea proof, then be my guest. The Hotel Brian, easily the worst hotel i have ever stayed in, one to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: slavinder
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brian is a good value for money - we paid 400 euros for 4 of us for 4 nights. Breakfast was indeed eggs! But there was also peanut butter and chocolate spread. The room was 2 single beds and bunk beds, the mattresses were a bit on the squidgy side but not too bad! We had the ground foor quad and i would strongly advice against this as its right next door to the lounge area and it can be very loud (mainly the staff i might add!) until quite late and in the morning. There isnt a shower on the ground floor so we had to go up stairs for that (and ask for the towels) the shower is fine for the job - nothing special but this is a budget hotel. Most of the staff are really friendly none were rude or unaccommodating The location is perfect 10 minute walk to the station and 10 minutes into Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brian”
Reviews.Author: Mexie
Reviews.Content: Booked this hostel after seeing the good reviews on here. It was very easy to find, in a good location close to the Dam Square but not actually in the red light district, so pretty quiet. I paid â‚¬145 for the room for 3 nights which I felt was good value. All we needed on arrival was â‚¬20 for a key deposit, we paid in full the next day. If you are used to self-catering and 1* accommodation, you will be happy with this place. It is very basic, but comfortable. I had booked a double room through hostelbookers but they only had a twin with bunk beds on the day. I was not happy about this, but the bottom bed was ok for 2 people for a few nights. The room also had a sink, chair, wall-mounted shelf/table, open wardrobe and a safe which didn't work. It was small and functional, but clean and didn't smell. Smoking is allowed in rooms. The 2 friends we were with had not booked, but as we arrived fairly late at night the staff let them have the available quad room (2 singles and 2 bunks) for the same price. We ended up using this as a kind of living room through the day. My friends said their single beds were too short. I personally didn't feel that the staff were overly friendly, but they weren't unfriendly either and we had no problems with them. We did often heard them arguing with each other and with other guests, though. The building was nice and warm and the shared shower (there is one on each floor), though a little musty smelling, was clean and the water was hot and powerful. Towels and bedlinen are provided, but we had to ask for the towels. The walls are very thin and you can hear every word in the next room. The stairs are very steep and narrow, but there is a quad room on the ground floor which is easily accessible. The reception area has about 6 tables of four where you can sit and relax, though the chairs are the typical coffee-shop chairs, hard and uncomfortable. Smoking is allowed and there is a computer with free internet access and a TV. Breakfast is served here from 8-9.30am, I didn't have any, but it seemed to consist of mainly eggs and bread. There is a little kitchen where you can make tea and coffee and cook food if you want to. Round the back of the hotel are some prostitute's windows, but it is about a 5-10 minute walk to the proper red light district. Within a 5 minute walk from the hotel there are lots of coffee-shops, restaurants, Central Station and tram stops. I would recommend this place for travellers on a budget, backpackers, groups of friends and younger couples. I would not recommend it for people with children, people with mobility problems or people who like luxurious hotels that they can spend all day in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brian - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: emleh
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Brian expecting the worst. As four 17year old girls we couldn't really afford anything particularly snazzy, so we settled for Hotel Brian. Of course, it's basic, but it's clean. We were most dreading the shared bathroom facilities but they were spotless, as was the kitchen and our room (until we got there). The hotel is cute and full of character, the staff are FANTASTIC (and absolutely hilarious) and there's a really nice, layed back feel to the place. Free tea and coffee all day comes in far more useful than you'd think aswell! Breakfast it simple but nice enough (though we only made it out for breakfast once). We felt really safe in Hotel Brian, we'd heard horror stories of how scary and dangerous Amsterdam is, but everyone was super helpful and made our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home ;)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: so...after i read reviews i was a bit scared about staying in that hotel... but it was great. its actually more like hostel, small and full of young (stoned and happy) people... i had good luck cuz i get room with good view, so if you can choose, try to get such one. its big diference. kitchen is sweet, feels like home. people who are working there are great. nobody steal anything to us. ill stay there again next time...

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our european holiday. Our stay at Hotel Brian was our most memorable in the whole 3 weeks. The staff were FANTASTIC!! We were greeted with such warmth and instantly made to feel at home. We were given maps and the staff circled all the places that we should see without us even asking. The rooms are very basic, but very clean. We spent a week at the hotel and were made to feel like part of the family. Each morning, you were cooked eggs and toast by a very enthusiastic guy called Allen (who can talk the leg off a wooden chair- DON"T GET HIM STARTED ON ANY DEEP CONVERSATIONS!! ha ha) One of the reception guys called Brent made our stay there great. He is the most friendly guy in the world and would do anything for anyone. He took us under his wing and showed us the sights of Amsterdam and told us all the do's and dont's. It is a great place to meet other travellers as there is a common room which everyone is welcome to use. We spent a lot of time there and made some good friends. The hotel has free internet that you can use any time, free tea and coffee and free use of the kitchen. The common room also has fox tv, but don't watch when Allen is on shift cause he watches the discovery channel and will start talking about the evolution and of man and wont stop even if you walk away. (nice guy though) There is no curfew and it is very secure. It is located right in the heart of Amsterdam - 5 minute walk to the red light district and main shopping mall. We highly reccommend this hotel to any budget traveller. Big thumbs up from us. Nikki and Kyle - Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is why: great location (on the canal, 5min from CS), quiet surroundings, budget price, very friendly staff, tasty breakfast, free coffee and internet, clean rooms, comfortable beds, always hot shower and clean wc...I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain, but watch out for ur wallet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're on a tight budget Hotel Brian is definitly the place. For 25euro a night it is a bargain, since you get a central location in Amsterdam, a great view on the Singel canal, clean sheets and a clean shared bathroom, free breakfast, free coffee and tea all day, free internet. You can also use the kitchen to make your own food. However, on the downside, someone stole our money while we were at breakfast, some 200euro, and as I can see here, it has happened before in this hostel. I would go back to hotel brian only if there was no other way to afford a better place, and I would take my money with me even to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel Brian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at several hotels in Amsterdam before staying at the Hotel Brian and the hotel brian was my favorite. While the rooms weren't exactly the nicest looking, the sheets and bathrooms were clean, you got breakfast in the morning, and the people who stayed and worked there were fabulous, there was also a computer that you could use for free in the lobby. The price was also the best that we found while in Amsterdam. I definetly plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the Brian. Great value budget accommodation...walkable to everything you would want to walk to. The staff are all very knowledgeable and great fun to boot. Recommended for those looking for cheap, friendly central accomm in the dam.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't normally write reviews but I saw that this hotel had got a bit of a slating from some people so thought I'd better redress the balance. YES the rooms ARE small, and YES the stairs ARE steep...but it's budget accomodation, in the heart of where you want to be in Amsterdam! It's walking distance from the station, two minutes from some of the best coffeeshops you're going to find and the staff are VERY welcoming and friendly. What more do you want??? If you're after luxury you pay 5 times as much and go elsewhere...there is no pretence at Hotel Brian, they offer cheap and clean accomodation for people who want an affordable trip to Amsterdam. The guy running it when we were there kept us happily entertained by just being him - open, down to earth and with a pythonesque kind of humour...and very helpful. Well recommended to anyone who isn't too whiney! - have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Costly Experience for us...”
Reviews.Author: Brockovich
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for us my boyfriend and I had a very bad experience whilst staying at this hotel (hostel). We had money taken from our locked room whilst at breakfast. Staff say that the safes in the rooms are broken and don't work but our's mysteriously was opened when returning to our room. We gather that whoever took the money had a key to the room then deposited the cash into the locked safe (they are always locked for this reason, hence the story they don't work) so as not to be seen/caught with the cash on them when exiting our room. Then when you leave the hotel for the day as we did someone then comes back into your locked room and unlocks the safe with their code and takes the cash. Fortunately for us the safe was not relocked properly and we put 2 and 2 together knowing we had not been able to unlock and access the safe ourselves. When reported to the police they were very aware of this scenario. No surprise whatsoeva to them, however staff had told us that they've never heard of it happening before earlier that day! They also have 2 other properties that may be mentioned when you are poached on the street outside central station (we later found out that this is illegal in amsterdam) Do yourself a favour and stay away, even if it seems a bargain price at 50 euro per night, it cost us sooo much more!

Reviews.Title: “Blessed Brian!”
Reviews.Author: caroline456
Reviews.Content: Cheap and you get a free breakfast and free internet. Had a double room - really nice canal view. Room was small but clean. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Good value for money and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise to find such an affordable hotel with everything we needed, without having to ride the bus to get everywhere. It had cleanliness, free internet, free coffee, friendly helpful staff, good breakfasts, and character It is situated right on the Singel Canal and is walking distance from the train station and downtown. Since this is an old canal house, the beds are tiny and the stairs are steep. They were putting new tiles in the hallway bathroom shower while we were there. Yes, we did meet potsmoking people there, and I was nervous because I am over 50, but we felt very welcome. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ladder with Carpet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lets get things straight, This place is great if you donâ€™t mind some compromise. I stayed on the Top Floor (Third Floor) Room 12, which I must say had its advantage.. On the good side : No People traipsing past your door when you eventually get back (My Room). Itâ€™s a Room Itâ€™s Dry Itâ€™s Secure The people are friendly enough Itâ€™s Cheep The Sheets are clean Clean Toilets On the Bad Side : Three Single beds and a Matress in the room In need of decoration Beds look like they come from a prison Stairs are so steep near the top they are more like a carpeted ladder on steroids. You can have breakfast and Drinks if you do it yourself and buy the ingredients. The Shower just has a small shelf to put all your stuff on. Personally I will stay elsewhere next time I am over in the dam.

Reviews.Title: “Stairway to HELL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms were grotty. I was on the top floor and the stairs were like climbing a sheer rock face, I had climb up them on my hands and knees as they were not wide enough to take my foot. Wardrobe just an empty shell without a rail. I got two fried eggs thrown at me for breakfast. Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Do yoursef a favour give it a miss!!

Reviews.Title: “i love these guys!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the owners of this hotel own another just down the street. we stayed there almost a month... it is a great place to have a home base for a long term visit. they are very sweet people, helpful, and there are lots of freebies included in the price of your room... i would stay here time and time again...

Reviews.Title: “Small n friendly n mad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel is small, clean, friendly, nice food apparently (i didnt get up!!) . the water was hot and the shower was clean. they has enough loo roll which is a plesent change in a shared bathroom. Great value for money, i will be visiting Hotel Brian again soon. the only drawback was the steep stairs but its the same everywhere in dam! lovely place with colourful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel brian the best in amsterdam chilled, layed back very good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good place very friendly staff, for the price its very good with no curfew relaxed rules. overall a excellent place to stay.definitly the best bet in town.

Reviews.Title: “bulb it up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BRIAN!!! Name says it all. (next door to a brothel ..what more can you say!) beer a euro under the guise of Fanta, love it. dont listen to the advise any of the staff give especially 'Bulb' as its basically all --------. They love the eggs! cheap and very cheefull, only stay there if you fancy recreating a hotel visit to Beirut circa 1982. But we absolutely loved it. Oh, and by the way, stay well clear of Cafe Los especially if you're a Welsh football fan - surreal isn't the word.

Reviews.Title: “Brian surgery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: if you are just after a roof over your head at a cheap rate then this place is for you. If you are after getting into a heated argument about the morals of S Club Juniors with some of the "colourful" characters who frequent the lobby then this place is for you. If you want to sleep in a military issue bunk bed that has a vaseline label stuck to one of it's rusting supports then this place is for you. Wasn't really for me though......

Reviews.Title: “ITS ALL YOU NEED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Chances are within the first five steps you take out the door of Central Station you'll be approached by a Hotel Brian employee...My advice to you...take them up on the offer...Great location...cheap rates...free breakfast...clean towels...GUARANTEED hot water...excellent staff...1 euro heinies...free internet...liberal drug policy...the list goes on... Young or old its the place you wanna call home during your stay in Amsterdam...Sure...the rooms are small and you have to share the bathrooms and showers with the rest of the guests but they're always available when you need them...and if you need more than that it means your spending way too much time in your hotel anyways...this is Amsterdam we're talking about here folks...get out...walk...ride a bike...there's much more to do outside...you're on vacation right...Save the "comforts" of home for home... Its a GREAT place and I highly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Singel Canal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for the guys. Women may not like to share the facilities. The place was clean, the staff was friendly, and it was very reasonably priced. I loved the view out the window of #12. Great proximity to everything, yet on a quiet canal. I'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here guys - It's a must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say?? Superb weekend, a stag weekend at the hotel Brian. Could not fault the place. Very hazy weekend, only complaint was that they run out of Heinekens or was it that we drunk them all??!!! Cheap saty - B&B excellent (2 x eggs!) Freindly, mad bloke looking after the boys. Definately be visiting this place again, what more can one say - Fantastic (I think!)
